p.s: In the following text iI will point out the consequences of Brexit, as well as the characteristics of a close relationship between the UK and the EU as indicated by Michel Barnier in his speech excerpt at the European American Chamber of Commerce.
The consequences of the Brexit are very big.
He means, that it is a lose-lose situation for both (ll. 4-10) what shows that this is just bad.
The Brexit will cost much and they will be substantially higher (l. 3, l. 9).
It will be very difficult to trade (l. 5).
This will have an impact on value chains, particular manufacturing and logistics as well as the argiculturalagricultural and food sector (ll. 6-8).
He also said, that they should prepare for the worst case scenario of a no deal (ll. 13-14).
In the following he talks about a close relationship between the UK and the EU.
He said, that this is their common interest.

There are many ways to achieve this first the EU Single Market is open to third countries, which include the UK, and second, long history of relying on the regulation, which is called equivalence (ll. 15-23).
Then he pointed out, that the EU is the most open jurisdiction in the world (l. 24) and asks why this would not work for the UK (l. 25-26).
The last thing he tells, is that the EU will not change because the UK is leaving.
So there are many bad consequences of the Brexit for the UK and the EU but with a close relationship between them it will be not that bad.
